title: Thunderbird pages jump
content:
I asked this question quite awhile ago, but never got an answer. I'm trying again.

When I delete an email, rather than the highlighted bar going to the next email below, it jumps to the next page. Why?

title: Can't Download Email from Microsoft 365 using Thunderbird 115.3.3
content:
About 2 weeks ago, (10/17/2023) release 115.3.3 was applied to my Thunderbird application. I can no longer download email from my Godaddy Microsoft 365 account. I use POP. Prior to the new release it worked fine. SMPT still works.

Are there setting changes I need to make with this release?

Thanks,

Randy
creator: randy68

title: RSS Feed Not Loading Favicon
content:
I have noticed that Thunderbird will load a site's favicon and use it as a little logo beside an RSS feed (pictured). However, I can not get it to load the favicon for my own site. I have used .png and .ico, but I am getting nowhere. I would very much like for my feed to show up to people who subscribe to it with an icon, so if anybody knows why this would be happening or can suggest debugging steps that would be awesome. For all I can tell, from using inspector, my RSS feed is set up just like the feeds that have icons, and my site has its favicon set up in the same way as the sites associated with the feeds that have favicons.

Thanks for your time.
creator: ask.yourself92

title: An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: you must enable authentication to use this mail server.
content:
Hi,

My Thunderbird browser stopped sending emails yesterday. I rang my email provider and logged in to the webmail where I found I couldn't send from there either as my account had been black-listed. This was due to someone else accessing my account from abroad so I changed my email login and it seemed to have fixed the problem. I even sent a test email from Thunderbird to myself which worked OK.

This morning the problem has resurfaced on Thunderbird but my webmail is working fine. I got the following error message when i sent an email from Thunderbird: 

Sending of the message failed.

An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: you must enable authentication to use this mail server.

This was the same error message that I got yesterday When the account had been black listed. I tried shutting down Thunderbird and restarting my computer but that didn't help. Any suggestions?

Regards Peter Clark pete1@slingshot.co.nz
creator: peter123456clark

title: Thunderbird not responding well after installing the Mozilla VPN
content:
I have noticed that after installing the Mozilla VPN my email is not responding as it did before. Example: clicking on a message does not always change it from unread to read. It will show some folders as having unread mail but nothing in there that is unread. Connecting to the server says many times now " Failed to connect" and I have to close and restart to get it to connect.

I never had these issues before I installed the VPN. I have not tried turning off VPN before connecting to see if that makes a difference but would be willing to try that if anyone else has had this problem.

Thank you.
creator: damcar

title: Sending emails from Thunderbird
content: My wife and I have the same settings on our Thunderbird email accounts for the outgoing server except for the user name. While I can send emails (after first entering my password for the first message of the day to be sent which previously I didn't have to do) my wife cannot send emails and receives the following Send Message Error: Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: mf-505: Sender Policy - Relay Denied. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again. Can you please advise how to correct his situation.
creator: bixfrom28

title: If I temporarily delete the email account which linked to Thunderbird , will the emails remain?
content:
The company I work is using the Google business starter and using own domains. Since next year, the company will not use Gmail anymore, to use other business groupware service. Workers need to keep e-mails they got, so I decided to use Thunderbird program to keep emails. But still, We are going to use same company e-mail domains.

The questions I have are :

1. If I temporarily delete the email account which linked to Thunderbird , will the emails remain? 

     (I linked my company email to Thunderbird. The Google account will be removed, but still use same domain in other service. In this case, does mails which are still linked except the removed moment?)

2. Is it able to download the mails as esv files?

Thank you for your supporting! Hope you guys have lovely day.
creator: beomjunny

title: Thunderbird 115 Chromebook addons
content: Greetings. I recently installed Thunderbird from the command line in a virtualized Linux environment on a Chromebook. After some difficulties (problematic attempt to import the profile, failed attempt to recover the labels, etc.) I managed to configure and everything seems to work. What absolutely doesn't work is the add-ons section: when I try to install one, at the end of the procedure, Thunderbird freezes and starts again only after restarting the virtual machine. I updated and upgraded the virtualized distro but to no avail. I also tried booting into "troubleshooting mode" but, again, Thunderbird crashes. Has anyone encountered similar problems on other Chromebooks? Thank you.
creator: mauriziodelladio

title: Supernova
content: I've seen a loss of e-mail password data across multiple OSs and platforms. This update created a real mess with an interface that is now hopelessly cluttered and confusing. I'll be looking for another e-mail client now after so many years using Thunderbird.

title: Migrating profile(s)
content: I have tried every method suggested here to migrate my emails and settings to my new computer, but nothing has worked. I tried the export then import path, but just kept getting an error message. Used all the folders just in case I was doing something wrong. So then I found the option of copying the old profile into the new profiles folder - that didn't work either. I just tried again importing from the file I exported, but it doesn't bring in anything at all. I am at a complete loss, I really don't want to lose all this information, which is why I did the export in the beginning.

title: Messages in Inbox Folder appear twice and remain with an empty entity when being deleted
content:
Dear Team,

this behavior in Thunderbird is long lasting for me and and in the new version 115.4.1 (32-bit) it is still here. For example from GMail Accounts I receive most of the Mails twice, two identical entries in the Inbox Folder. After deleting one of it, an empty entity remains in the Folder, see attached Screen.

Thanks for any hint on this to fix it.

Best regards Chris
creator: aic248

title: Formatting text in Thunderbird
content: I have moved to Thunderbird (latest update to version 115.4.1). In my old mailprogram, when using HTML, I could compose texts from different sources, then format the text altogether, regardless where they came from and the text appeared as intended at the recipient. In Thunderbird I never really succeeded with that. When I compose text from different sources in a mail, I find no way to assign the same font size to it, not to speak about font type. When I check by sending mails to myself, the texts appear in different sizes, whatever I do. A solution at the moment is to compose the mail in a Word processor, format it there and then copy & paste it to the Thunderbird mail window. But that can hardly be the only way.... Is there any way to format mail when the content consists of texts from different sources?
creator: newsletters2

title: How to Export Outlook Emails to Thunderbird Account?
content:
I have an Outlook PSt File that I want to open in my Thunderbird account. However, Thunderbird doesn't support the PST file. After searching I came to know that, to OSt fiel in Thunderbird, I need to convert PST to MBOX file and then import it. But the issue is I am not able to do it. Please help me to complete this task. For that, you can try Xtraxtor PST to MBOX Converter software on your Windows OS system.

For more info - https://xtraxtor.com/blog/how-to-convert-pst-to-mbox-format/
creator: aloraeve01

title: Send Mail on Linux & Windows issue
content:
Hello, I have Thunderbird running on two different OS's. Linux (115.3.1) and Windows 11.(115.4.1). Both act the same way. Both are have the same email address and are linked to two gmail accounts. I have noticed that web based gmail email there is only a "Sent" Folder. On Thunderbird there is a "Sent" and "Sent Mail" folder. on one account the other only has "Sent" They are not always in sync. When I send an email, sometimes it seems to "Hang" sometimes not. I am wondering if I can remove the "Sent Mail" folder or the "Sent" folder as that could be causing the problem?

Thanks in advance.
